wikipedia_page.main: Colin Blackburn, Baron Blackburn,  (18 May 1813 – 8 January 1896) was a Scottish judge who sat in the English courts, became a Law Lord and is remembered as one of the greatest exponents of the common law.

response: * 8 January – Colin Blackburn, Baron Blackburn, judge (born 1813)
*1879 - A Royal Commission under Colin Blackburn, Baron Blackburn recommends and drafts a code.
*Ellis and BlackburnBy Thomas Flower Ellis and Colin Blackburn, Baron Blackburn: Trove.
*Colin Blackburn, Baron Blackburn, a Scottish judge who sat in the English courts

link_mentions.page: Colin Blackburn, Baron Blackburn of Killearn

response: Hugh Blackburn was brought up at Killearn House, Stirlingshire, the seventh of eight children of the wealthy Glasgow merchant John Blackburn and his wife Rebecca Leslie Gillies, the daughter of a Church of Scotland minister, and a relative of Colin Maclaurin. His elder brother was the judge Colin Blackburn, Baron Blackburn. His father, John, became wealthy off sugar and slavery in Jamaica, becoming a merchant on his return to Glasgow. In the 1830s, when the British government emancipated the slaves, John received compensation for the ownership of over 550 slaves.https://www.ucl.ac.uk/lbs/person/view/20601
